txt.en: 'I know little of the Dead, and count myself lucky. Who can say what drove them to meet with that curious company and its grim-faced leader?\n\n'You know of this man. I can see it in your face. Are you willing to speak of him?'
Talk to Rovalang and experience 'Interlude: Those Who Are Dead'

Rovalang beheld a frightening meeting atop the Hill of Erech, and does not know what it signifies, but you know part of its significance, at the least: Aragorn spoke with the oath-breakers in the dead of night.
'I am unsure what this meeting means for Gondor, but I know it will be significant. Let our own meeting be as timely, but let it signify only good fortune for the kingdom I serve!'

'You may keep your secrets, my interesting friend. I do not wish to pry. Only the Dead know what drove them to the Hill of Erech to meet with this grim man, but I do believe you know more of this matter than you let on.'
Rovalang stands on the slope of the Hill of Erech.\n\nRovalang wishes to learn more of the meeting between the Dead and Aragorn, if you are willing to speak to him.
Rovalang is on the slope of the Hill of Erech.
